title: Stanford Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI) | Stanford Online
snippet: Stanford founded the Institute for Human-Centered AI in 2019 to guide and build the future of AI.HAI advances AI research, education, policy and practice to improve the human condition.

title: Stanford University launches the Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence | Stanford Report
snippet: Stanford HAI aims to become a global, inter-disciplinary hub for discussion and development of AI. Stanford President Marc Tessier-Lavigne said artificial intelligence has the potential to radically change how we live our lives. “Now is our opportunity to shape that future by putting humanists and social scientists alongside people who are developing artificial intelligence,” he said. “This approach aligns with Stanford’s founding purpose to produce knowledge for the betterment of humanity.

title: At five years old, Institute for Human-Centered AI looks to the future
snippet: In HAI’s five years of operation, the institute has focused on policy, research and education and has funded the research projects of more than 400 faculty, said HAI co-founder and co-director James Landay, a computer science professor.
